slides.title: Welcome to HTML
slides.content:
# Welcome to HTML üåê

HTML (**H**yper**T**ext **M**arkup **L**anguage) is the standard markup language for creating web pages. It describes the structure of a web page.

## What you'll learn:

- üèóÔ∏è **HTML Structure** - The skeleton of a webpage
- üè∑Ô∏è **Tags & Elements** - The detailed building blocks
- ‚öôÔ∏è **Attributes** - Configuring elements
- üìù **Best Practices** - Writing clean HTML

> üí° **Fun Fact:** HTML was invented by Tim Berners-Lee in 1991.

Let's start building!

slides.title: HTML Attributes
slides.content: # HTML Attributes ‚öôÔ∏è Attributes provide additional information about HTML elements. They are always specified in the **start tag**. ## Syntax `name="value"` ## Common Attributes - `href` in ``: Specifies the URL. - `src` in ``: Specifies the image path. - `width` and `height`: Specify dimensions. - `alt`: Alternative text for images. - `style`: Adds inline CSS styles. - `lang`: Declares the language of the web page. ```html Visit Google ```

# The 'style' Attribute üé® The `style` attribute allows you to add styling (CSS) directly to an element. ## Syntax `` ## Examples ```html

# The Element üß† The `` element is a container for metadata (data about data). ## Common Head Elements - ``: Defines the document title. - `<meta>`: Define character set, page description, keywords, author, and viewport settings. - `<link>`: Links to external resources (like CSS). - `<style>`: Defines internal CSS. - `<script>`: Defines or links to JavaScript. ```html <head> <meta charset="UTF-8"> <meta name="description" content="Free Web tutorials"> <meta name="keywords" content="HTML, CSS, JavaScript"> <meta name="author" content="John Doe"> </head> ``` <!-- FULL_CODE_START <!DOCTYPE html> <html> <head> <title>My Helper Page

slides.title: Doctype Declaration
slides.content:
# <!DOCTYPE html> üìú

The `<!DOCTYPE>` declaration represents the document type and helps browsers validly display web pages.

## Key Facts
- It must only appear once, at the top of the page.
- It is **not** an HTML tag.
- The declaration for HTML5 is simple:

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
```

> Without this, browsers might render pages in "Quirks Mode," causing unexpected layout issues.

slides.title: HTML Paragraphs
slides.content:
# HTML Paragraphs üìù The `

` element defines a paragraph. ## Spacing Browsers automatically add a single blank line before and after each `

` element. ## Line Breaks If you want a line break (a new line) without starting a new paragraph, use the `
` tag. ```html

This is
a paragraph
with line breaks.

``` ## Preformatted Text The `
` tag preserves both spaces and line breaks:

```html

  My Bonnie lies over the sea.


```

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Summary üåü

You've taken your first step into Web Development!

## Key Takeaways
- ‚úÖ **HTML** structure is the skeleton of the web.
- ‚úÖ **Tags** come in pairs (start/end) or are empty.
- ‚úÖ **Elements** are the building blocks.
- ‚úÖ **Attributes** configure elements in the start tag.
- ‚úÖ **Structure** requires `<html>`, `<head>`, and `<body>`.

Next, we'll look at how to create interactions using **Forms**! üöÄ
